channel.title: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client
channel.description:
Hey,
I've been trying to change the owner crown on the ruse source/client. I've tryed searching for (obv in the client folder): sprite, icon, crown and it came up with java files.. Does anybody know where i find the png files so i can change it?
If it is located in one of the java files, which one is it and how do i change it the owner icon/crown)?
Thank you very much

item.title: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client
item.dc:creator: @Soulxs Soulxs
item.description:
@Soulxs wrote:

Alright. If you get back on your PC and i haven’t edited this post saying i got it yet, could you send it to me?
EDIT: I honestly can’t find a working link. If anyone could please upload his that would be amazing

Read full topic
item.source: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client

item.title: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client
item.dc:creator: @WarTusk-RSPS WarTusk-RSPS
item.description:
@WarTusk-RSPS wrote:

[quote=“Soulxs, post:5, topic:553613”]That did indeed fix it, but how do i figure out which one is supposed to be the owner crown? ^^
I’m thinking it’s either 229 or 238. Do you know which one? Saves me some time trying to find out ^^
If you don’t know what i mean by these numbers;

d62e121f32.png1316×154

EDIT: I just replaced one of them with another crown, but how do i ever get these back in the sprite cache? Because the download links to galkon’s sprite cache tool are broken…[/quote]

I’m on mobile so I can’t send you mine, but there are a few links out there, just takes some searching. That is the only way I know how to cache pack the sprites back in. Glad it fixed the problem for you though

Read full topic

item.source: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client

item.title: How do i change the rank icons? - Ruse Source/Client
item.dc:creator: @WarTusk-RSPS WarTusk-RSPS
item.description:
@WarTusk-RSPS wrote:

[quote=“Soulxs, post:3, topic:553613”][quote]
To dump sprites simply open ‘SpriteLoader.java’ and find this method:

Code:

public static void createSprite(SpriteLoader sprite, boolean second) { /* File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + "dump"); if (!directory.exists()) { directory.mkdir(); } FileOperations.WriteFile(directory.getAbsolutePath() + System.getProperty("file.separator") + sprite.id + ".png", sprite.spriteData); */ if(!second) { sprites[sprite.id] = new Sprite(sprite.spriteData); sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetX = sprite.drawOffsetX; sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetY = sprite.drawOffsetY; } }
Uncomment the dumping, so it looks like this:

Code:

[code]public static void createSprite(SpriteLoader sprite, boolean second) {
File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + “dump”); if
(!directory.exists()) { directory.mkdir(); } FileOperations.WriteFile(directory.getAbsolutePath() +
System.getProperty(“file.separator”) + sprite.id + “.png”,
sprite.spriteData);

	if(!second) {
		sprites[sprite.id] = new Sprite(sprite.spriteData);
		sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetX = sprite.drawOffsetX;
		sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetY = sprite.drawOffsetY;
	}
}

[/code]
It will now dump all sprites once client loads into a folder called ‘dump’ in the cache. You will be able to change packed sprites. Make sure to repack the sprites once you’ve done your changes using Galkon’s sprite cache tool.
Oh and remember to comment out the dumping again once you’re done, so it doesn’t dump sprites each time you load the client.
[/quote]

Do you mean that? Uncommented the section he was talking about and got this error:

[code]

C:\Users\Ruben\Desktop\Project RSPS\Full Ruse package\source\Client>title Ruse

C:\Users\Ruben\Desktop\Project RSPS\Full Ruse package\source\Client>“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60\bin\javac.exe” -d bin -cp lib/*;src src\Client.java
src\SpriteLoader.java:91: error: cannot find symbol
File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + “dump”); if
^
symbol: class File
location: class SpriteLoader
src\SpriteLoader.java:91: error: cannot find symbol
File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + “dump”); if
^
symbol: class File
location: class SpriteLoader
Note: src\Flo.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors

C:\Users\Ruben\Desktop\Project RSPS\Full Ruse package\source\Client>pause
Press any key to continue . . .

[/code][/quote]

It is missing an import at the top. Can you post which imports you have on the top of spriteloader.java?

This is what I have

import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
import java.io.DataInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream;
import java.io.File;

If you are missing any of those then add the missing one.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Soulxs Soulxs
item.description:
@Soulxs wrote:

To dump sprites simply open 'SpriteLoader.java' and find this method:

Code:

public static void createSprite(SpriteLoader sprite, boolean second) { /* File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + "dump"); if (!directory.exists()) { directory.mkdir(); } FileOperations.WriteFile(directory.getAbsolutePath() + System.getProperty("file.separator") + sprite.id + ".png", sprite.spriteData); */ if(!second) { sprites[sprite.id] = new Sprite(sprite.spriteData); sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetX = sprite.drawOffsetX; sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetY = sprite.drawOffsetY; } }
Uncomment the dumping, so it looks like this:

Code:

[code]public static void createSprite(SpriteLoader sprite, boolean second) {
File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + “dump”); if
(!directory.exists()) { directory.mkdir(); } FileOperations.WriteFile(directory.getAbsolutePath() +
System.getProperty(“file.separator”) + sprite.id + “.png”,
sprite.spriteData);

	if(!second) {
		sprites[sprite.id] = new Sprite(sprite.spriteData);
		sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetX = sprite.drawOffsetX;
		sprites[sprite.id].drawOffsetY = sprite.drawOffsetY;
	}
}

[/code]
It will now dump all sprites once client loads into a folder called ‘dump’ in the cache. You will be able to change packed sprites. Make sure to repack the sprites once you’ve done your changes using Galkon’s sprite cache tool.
Oh and remember to comment out the dumping again once you’re done, so it doesn’t dump sprites each time you load the client.

Do you mean that? Uncommented the section he was talking about and got this error:


C:\Users\Ruben\Desktop\Project RSPS\Full Ruse package\source\Client>title Ruse

C:\Users\Ruben\Desktop\Project RSPS\Full Ruse package\source\Client>"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60\bin\javac.exe" -d bin -cp lib/*;src src\Client.java

                                File directory = new File(signlink.findcachedir() + "dump"); if
                                ^
  symbol:   class File

2 errors

Press any key to continue . . .

Look on the download page it has instructions how to dump the sprites and edit them under the download spoiler .

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/downloads/606076-ruse-release-grand-exchange-ironman-modes-extremely-stable-anti-ctf-wpe.html
